fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom
Class DicomMetadata

Object
  IIOMetadata
      DicomMetadata
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DicomMetadata
extends IIOMetadata
implements Serializable

Contains all dicom data elements of a DICOM object being read or written.

mergeTree

public void mergeTree(String formatName,
                      Node root)
               throws IIOInvalidTreeException
Alters the internal state of this DicomMetadata object from a tree of XML DOM Nodes of the native (DICOM) or standard (Image I/O) format.

If standard metadata are supplied, interpreted information elements are:

  • BlackIsZero (PhotometricInterpretation=MONOCHROME1)
  • Palette,
  • Horizontal and VerticalPhysicalPixelSpacing,
  • ImageCreationTime,
  • ImageModificationTime.

Specified by:
mergeTree in class IIOMetadata
Throws:
IIOInvalidTreeException

reset

public void reset()
Specified by:
reset in class IIOMetadata

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object

setAttribute

public void setAttribute(int tag,
                         Object value)
Sets the value of an attribute.

Depending on the value representation (VR) of the attribute, there may be restrictions on the acceptable classes for value. If these restrictions are not followed, exceptions will be thrown when writing the object.

VRAccepted classes
AT (Attribute Tag)Integer, Integer[]
DA (Date)Date, Date[]
DT (Date Time)Date, Date[]
FL (Float)Number, Number[]
FD (Double)Number, Number[]
OB (Other Byte String)byte[]
OW (Other Word String)short[]
OF (Other Float String)float[]
SQ (Sequence)DataSet, Collection of DataSets
TM (Time)Date, Date[]
UL (Unsigned Long)Number, Number[]
SL (Signed Long)Number, Number[]
US (Unsigned Short)Number, Number[]
SS (Signed Short)Number, Number[]

Other VR accept any class for value and will use value.toString() to encode the attribute value.

The PixelData attribute is a special case, and should not be set using this method.

A null value is always acceptable.

setModality

public void setModality(String modality)
                 throws DicomException
Convenient method to set the Modality attribute after checking that the modality is known.

Know modalities are:

CR
Computed Radiography
CT
Computed Tomography
MR
Magnetic Resonance
NM
Nuclear Medicine
US
Ultra sound
XA
X-Ray Angiography
RF
Radio Fluoroscopy
RTIMAGE
Radiotherapy Image
DX
Digital Radiography
MG
Mammography
IO
Intra-oral Radiography
ES
Endoscopy
GM
General Microscopy
SM
Slide Microscopy
XC
External-camera Photography
PT
Positron Emission Tomography (PET)
HC
Hard Copy
OT
Other

Throws:
DicomException - if the modality is unknown.

getAttribute

public Object getAttribute(int tag)
Gets the value of an attribute as an Object.

The class of the returned object depends on the value representation (VR) of the attribute when the object was read and on the number of values (Value Multiplicity).

VRPossible classes
AE (Application Entity)String, String[]
AS (Age)String, String[]
AT (Attribute Tag)Integer, Integer[]
CS (Code String)String, String[]
DA (Date)Day, Day[]
DS (Decimal String)Double, Double[]
DT (Date Time)Date, Date[]
FL (Float)Float, Float[]
FD (Double)Double, Double[]
IS (Integer String)Integer, Integer[]
LO (Long String)String, String[]
LT (Long Text)String, String[]
OB (Other Byte String)byte[]
OW (Other Word String)short[]
OF (Other Float String)float[]
PN (PersonName)PersonName, PersonName[]
SH (Short String)String, String[]
SL (Signed Long)Integer, Integer[]
SQ (Sequence)Vector of DataSets
SS (Signed Short)Short, Short[]
ST (Long Text)String, String[]
TM (Time)Time, Time[]
UI (UID)String, String[]
UL (Unsigned Long)Long, Long[]
UN (Unknown)byte[]
US (Unsigned Short)Integer, Integer[]
UT (Unlimited Text)String

A null value is returned if the meta data does not contain the attribute or if the attribute has no value.

When values are kept raw (see DicomReader.setRawValues(fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.RawValues), QueryRetrieveSCU.setRawValues(fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.RawValues) and StorageSCP.setRawValues(fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.RawValues)) they are returned as byte[] instead, except when the VR is SQ.

The PixelData attribute is a special case, and should not be read using this method.

Some tags (only EncapsulatedDocument for now) are also a special case, and should be read as stream (see copyAttributeStream(int, OutputStream) and copyAttributeStream(int, DataOutput)).

getAttributeString

public String getAttributeString(int tag)
Gets the value of an attribute as a String.

Returns null if the attribute has a null value or if the attribute is not present in the meta data.

Explicitely sets the SOP class. Useful when it cannot be guessed from the Modality attribute and the image layout.

See Also:
UID.create()

applyGrayscaleTransformations

public BufferedImage applyGrayscaleTransformations(BufferedImage bi,
                                                   int num)
Applies the Modality, VOI and Presentation LUTs, if they are present in this metadata, to the specified BufferedImage, and returns a new BufferedImage.

Modality LUTs are applied by changing the samples of the image. The sample data type may differ between the specified image and the returned image.

VOI LUTs are applied by attaching a specific color model to the returned image. When no VOI LUT is specified but LargestImagePixelValue is, a VOI LUT is created using SmallestImagePixelValue and LargestImagePixelValue if present, else using the actual smallest and largest pixel values found in the image.

Presentation LUTs are applied by selecting a specific color space.

Since several LUTs may be present for each frame in a multiframe DICOM dataset, a frame index must be specified.

Parameters:
bi - the input image
num - the frame index
Returns:
the output image

removeUnwritableElements

public void removeUnwritableElements()
Removes the data elements which VR is unknown (because the tag is not in the dictionary and the element was not read from an explicit-VR transfer syntax).
